sage.physics.JBullet

Class JBulletPhysicsEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.physics.JBullet.JBulletPhysicsEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPhysicsEngine

    public class JBulletPhysicsEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements IPhysicsEngine
    This class provides an implementation of the IPhysicsEngine interface using the JBullet physics engine.
    Author:
    Russell Bolles, John Clevenger (JavaDoc)

    • Method Detail

      • initSystem

        public void initSystem()
        #initSystem() initializes the underlying physics engine, providing an (empty) "physics world" along with a default collision handler, collision dispatcher, and constraint solver. The default physics world extents are {-10,000 ... 10,000} in each of X, Y, and Z; object locations should be constrained to these bounds for proper physics calculations. The implementation's default gravity vector in the physics world is [0,0,0] (meaning gravity is turned off by default). Note that this means the implementation does not use the DEFAULT_GRAVITY constants defined in IPhysicsEngine.
        Specified by:
        initSystem in interface IPhysicsEngine

      • setGravity

        public void setGravity(float[] gravity_vector)
        Sets the gravity vector for the physics world to the specified [x,y,z] vector.
        Specified by:
        setGravity in interface IPhysicsEngine
        Parameters:
        gravity_vector - The X,Y,Z components of the gravity vector in the physics simulation

      • addBoxObject

        public IPhysicsObject addBoxObject(int uid,
                                   float mass,
                                   double[] transform,
                                   float[] size)
        Adds a IPhysicsObject object of type Box to the physics world.
        Specified by:
        addBoxObject in interface IPhysicsEngine
        Parameters:
        uid - The unique ID of the box object
        mass - The mass of the box
        transform - An array of 4x4=16 floats defining the initial transform applied to the box
        size - An array of 3 floats giving the dimensions [x,y,z] of the box
        Returns:
        A reference to the box which was addded to the physics world

      • removeObject

        public void removeObject(int uid)
        Removes the IPhysicsObject with the specified UID from the physics world, if it exists in the world. This method has no effect if no object with the specified UID exists in the physics world.
        Specified by:
        removeObject in interface IPhysicsEngine
        Parameters:
        uid - The ID of the object to be removed
